description:
My girls and I arrived at this place after driving past two other boba guys.  The only reason why we came here is because the parking is a bit better.  Which is definitely a plus in San Francisco!!   When we arrived at the location, there was a lot of people in line already, the most confusing part is the line for ordering and line for picking up kinda merged into one line.  So we had to ask who was actually in line and who was waiting for their drink.
My friend and I both ordered Medium strawberry matcha latte (soooooo good!!)  and my other friend got a hong kong style milk tea with boba (25% sweet).  
When I first tried it i was a little iffy about it, because thinking of strawberry with match just seems a bit odd.  But when i tried it, i couldnt stop drinking it.  The boba was also so fresh and chewy!!!  

The Hong kong style milk tea was pretty good as well.  But if i ever make the trip from San Leandro to San Fran I will def take advantage of getting the matcha strawberry milk tea!!
author: Irene M.

description:
Drinks: They have a decent variety of drinks here (milk teas, green teas, fruity teas, etc.) and I went with the highly recommended Strawberry Matcha with boba and it was quite delicious. I loved the strawberry and matcha flavor - they complimented each other well. The sweetness was pretty good and it can also be adjusted by a staff member. The boba topping was also very soft and chewy! 

Location: Just a short walk from Dolores Park in the Mission District. It's a cute shop but its also pretty small so you will most likely not spend much time there. 

Parking: Street parking but can be hard to find on the weekends.

Service: Pretty quick for a weekday; will not be much of a wait. 

Prices: It can be pretty pricey, it will cost you about $5 or more for a drink here.
author: Michelle T.

description:
I like that Boba Guys offers Hong Kong Milk Tea. All other boba places use Jasmine or green tea and there's never that much tea flavor, but by using black tea, the tea you're ordering actually tastes like tea! And of course you can't go wrong when you add condensed milk to anything. 

Would be nice if they offered light foods (maybe toast with condensed milk?!), but for now, the milk tea will do.
author: Cal C.

description:
Aw do it again. After hearing a lot of good reports about Boba guys from my friends and former coworkers, I decided to take the opportunity to give it a shot. My usual behavior was that I grab a drink after any interview and by chance and fate boba guys was nearby. There are multiple locations nearby and this one is the most convenient one. Why? There is a lot of parking nearby on the weekdays and all you do is park, cross the street and walk right in. You can even ride a bus and go right in. In terms of flavor, I really like it. The drink I had was real fruity and has a great taste in my mouth. It's really on point. This location seems to be a huge hit among SF natives and Academy of Art students. They have WiFi too upon request. 
Drawback: cash is not accepted but who the heck even cares? No one
author: Michael W.

description:
Yay!! Sooo happy I don't have to go driving into the City, look for parking and wait in a long line for boba. This location is only 5 minutes walking distance from my job and I couldn't be happier!
I went it at 1:25pm and only 2 people in front of me. There was a large group finishing up to get their drinks and once they cleared out, there was plenty of room!
I was out of there within 8 minutes with my iced Strawberry Matcha latte w/ boba. It was so pretty before I mixed it up. The boba was probably the freshest I've had- super soft, chewy and didn't get hard sitting in my iced drink. (could also have been cause I didn't let it sit that long... it was too good!)
They mentioned if I didn't like my drink, I could tell them and they'd remake it. I had mine with organic milk and 75% sweetness. It was perfect!

I'll be back soon to try the rest of their drinks!
author: Mimie L.

description:
I don't get boba often, but when I do...

It's wherever is closest and good.

But when that place is Boba Guys, I'm pretty excited! I'm not sure why. Maybe because it feels bougie? Maybe because the consistency of their boba is chewy and fresh? Maybe it's the aardvark. We could go on for days.

Eff it, let's do it. Maybe it's the white interior. Or the quality of their matcha? Maybe it's their hidden seasonal menu that you only notice at the register causing you to question your decision and last-second-switch to the mango paradise and wonder if you just made a horrible mistake. Or stand your ground and regret not trying something new.

Mistakes or regrets. The meaning of life #tooreal

Really though, I usually enjoy my drinks here. The people here are friendly, the drinks are good, and they sell boba bae shirts :)
author: Greg G.

description: Can't go wrong with getting a drink at boba guys!This location is the only one (as of now) with the USA made boba that Boba Guys is testing out. There isn't a huge difference but I think these are softer / a little bit less chewy since they are smaller.
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
This was my first stop off in boba guys and it was great! I've got a couple friends here in SF that recommended it as their favorite local boba spot and I was not disappointed. Service was pretty fast (unusual from what I heard, mainly because the lines tend to be super long here). But we were served in less than 5 minutes. They have a limited menu selection - items like matcha green tea, tropic thunder, classic boba etc but that honestly helps them to keep a high quality product (you know they aren't dinking around with a million recipes - just stick to what you know well).

The prices are also pretty good for the 16 oz cups it is roughly $5 plus some tax for the drink - the 24 oz cup will run you a bit more.

In addition to all the fun Nina options they also have a number of auxiliary products that are available for purchase. Great spot to stop by and there's many of them throughout the city!
author: Andrew C.

description:
This specific Boba Guys location is one of my favorite places to get boba in the city! Their boba balls are always the perfect amount of chewiness and sweetness.

I usually don't like my drinks really sweet, but 75% sugar is a good amount if the drink you get is adjustable; below that level I feel like the drink gets a little watery. Some of my favorites are their Jasmine Green Milk Tea, Thai Tea, and Tropic Thunder (with more grapefruit and less coconut milk)! Love that they're always more than happy to fix your drink if you aren't satisfied.

Also I love that they stock Third Culture Bakery pastries! Mochi Muffins, Mochi Donuts, and Thai Tea Custards are deliciousss. My favorite is probably the Matcha Mochi Donut.

The interior is really cute, and there's a nice park right outside where the doggos come out to play if weather is nice. (:
author: Alice C.

description:
Alright. So let's talk boba and tea. I was very, very happy with the taste of the tea itself. It was brewed nicely and I love when you can customize the level of sweetness and the type of milk that can go in your boba. Only in California! 

I think I paid exactly 5.50 for original black milk tea with boba. Is that pricy? Ehhh yeah, but it's good. I hate when places make you pay for boba, but that's another story. It's steeped nicely in honey, but isn't naturally over-sweetened. I would recommend getting between 50-75% sweetness, if possible. 100% is just too sweet though guys! 

I liked the flavor and it was smooth. Good boba and so I don't know why people be trippin. 

What to try: OG iced milk tea

Water rating: 9/10
author: Amanda P.

description:
This place is hecking yum. I was visiting from out of state and this is the first boba shop I went to. I came right around opening and was really glad I made a stop here. This location is kept clean and the employees are kind. My order was taken quickly and also quickly made. There's not a lot of so it may become crowded as it gets busy. A negative is that when I went to get water, the water had a slight yellowish tint to it so I had to dump it out.

As for my impression of Boba Guys as a franchise, I think they may be one of my favorite. They have a wide variety on their menu and the ones I've tried (strawberry matcha, manga matcha, manga fresca) were all delicious and refreshing. They also have a variety of toppings and allow you to adjust the sweetness to your taste.
author: Ji L.

description:
This boba guys has the best area for parking i've seen.
And it's also never had too long of a line every time i've been here.

They got my order wrong once, but they took care of it.
but even the wrong drink was still good.

This location was trying out a new boba when i last came, and it was pretty disgusting. They were getting feedback on the boba and the feedback was not good.
I'm surprised that they decided to continue to charge customers for boba during this experimental boba phase because it was pretty gross. My friend decided not to eat them at all, and i just left them in my cup, strategic positioning of my straw to avoid the boba.
author: Connie T.

description:
After trying the matcha with oat milk drink, I decided I am now a fan of Boba Guys. 

I have made my way back multiple times to try other things.

Strawberry matcha - more for the photo I guess. Personally, I don't love strawberry jam/preserve type things so I didn't love the fruity component mixed with matcha here. Others may feel different.

Horchata - eh. Tasted somewhere between too sweet and too watery.

Hojicha - this was okay. I prefer this over the horchata drink. 

Anyways, four stars because the people who work here are super nice and have offered to remake drinks if you don't like them. Now that I know what I like, I'm going to keep coming back for the matcha with oat milk.
author: Sophia L.

description:
First of all, I love this location bcs there's so much free parking within walking distance. (If you are patient to circle around the block a few times) 
I love the menu set up and how it shows you how to order and choose your drink. Plus, it's just so neat... it's the small things that get me, okay? Lol I appreciated that they had a few diff types of milk to choose from and a few unique teas, but also the traditionals. I ordered the Thai tea w/boba and it was so yummy! The boba was fresh and the tea was perfect. I've tried lots of different boba places and so I was def happy with this one! 

The service is super quick and the workers are super friendly and patient. I can't wait to come back & try other flavors!
author: Jenae K.

description:
One of my fav boba spots, this particular location is my fav location.

I love the boba guys concept : the best ingredients in what isn't a very healthy drink to begin with (so i feel a tad better... hah)! They use only the freshest premium ingredients (real milk, real cream, real fruit!)

Lately, they've introduced such a variety of options beyond milk tea, which I love. Their mango tea Fresca is so refreshing on a summer day (mango, green tea, no sugar adjustments but you can ask them to dilute the mango with more green tea!).

My otherwise go to drink is jasmine milk tea with oat milk (!!!) and boba. 

Boba guys doesn't charge more to substitute milk options like other drink chains, and

Always great service. Place is impeccably clean, organized and welcoming. 

There is seating, the space is airy, this nice location next to a green space to sit out on grass and enjoy a sunny afternoon.

Parking is terrible on the weekdays but ok on the weekends.
author: Karen H.

description:
After visiting SF a few more times, this one is my favorite one to go too! 
The staff here is super friendly and quick. Plus, I think the lines here are much much shorter than some of the other locations in the SF area.
This past weekend we had their seasonal specials, Peach Palmer which is one of my favorite ones I've had their and the Golden Honey Black Tea which was also very good!
author: Jane C.

description:
Wonderful experience here!

+ Interior is bright, airy, beautifully designed
+ Friendly staff takes your order & charges you in line to speed things up
+ Matcha latte is always delicious, I got 75% sweetness and was still quite sweet
+ Slightly pricey but better ingredients are part of the cost
+ Oat meal is offered as an alternative to organic milk
author: Annie D.

description:
I love that this amazing local company has blown up like it has! Boba Guys has about a half dozen SF/Peninsula locations; a shop in LA; & when I saw them in New York, I almost shed a tear that they'd made it to the other coast. 

Almost every drink I get here, I order 75% sweet & with almond jelly. My usuals are Jasmine Milk Tea or Hong Kong Style Milk Tea. I decided to try the Calipico on my last visit. The red gradient from the strawberry purée melds with a somewhat thick yogurt consistency. Won't be my new usual, but I enjoyed having something different for once. As with most of their drinks, stir before drinking or you'll end up sipping all the good, sugary stuff off the bottom first. 

Friendliest Boba Guys staff!
author: Fancypants X.

description:
So yummy and everyone there was so friendly. They really have a great policy where if you don't absolutely love it they'll make you something new. Luckily we all loved our drinks so there was no need to get different ones but that is a cool way of running their business. 

They have cool flavors, House made products, and different kinds of milk for our non dairy friends. 

I tried the black sesame. Very yummy, and very unique. I loved it even tho it was kinda weird.
author: Hayley G.

description:
Pros: boba itself is well cooked, softer than most.  Nice jelly coating.  Very instagrammable interior for all the young whippersnappers.  Different milk options in your tea.
Cons: The Strawberry Matcha was too sweet.  Tasted like jam in my boba drink.  

I'd come back for a simpler drink that I could modify the sweetness level.
author: Derrick C.

description:
Best thing about this place is there are plenty of parking!!
- usually on a busy day I wait for less than 8 minutes for my drink. 
- non caffeine choices: strawberry rice milk & taro drink is a bit sweet. Love their sesame latte & chocolata. Horchata is awesome too.
-Love their matcha pastry although it sells out very fast
-Also fun places to visit nearby: Philz coffee in 2 blocks, A design school around the corner, and Icecream shop next to Philz.
-HK toast (honey drizzles and cream on thick toast) is a sweet & filling snack. Better split it with a friend!
-Overall friendly staff & environment. The store can get busier in the afternoon.
author: Jess W.

description:
It seems like each Boba Guy's has its own specialty drinks that are unique to the location. This location however has many of the special drinks as standard drinks on the menu!

I had the Guava with Kiwi tea drink this time and it tasted excellent. It is a bit light tasting in some parts and is quite different from what you would expect in teas normally, but it was nonetheless delicious and would I recommend it!

There are so many flavors at boba guys it's going to take forever to try them all!
author: Tyler T.

description: I think Boba Guys is among the top boba places in the city. My favorite drink is their Muscat Oolong, with boba, regular milk, and 25% sweetness. It has a tinge of muscat (green grape) flavor that you can taste but not overwhelming. I get it 80% of the time I'm here.
author: Jessie L.

description:
I had really high expectations for Boba Guys. Especially after waiting in line for bubble tea and watching people walk out with colorful drinks. 

I ordered the strawberry matcha with almond jelly. Almond jelly was on point, but the all I could taste from my drink was the sweet strawberry. It was overbearing and didn't get any matcha vibes.

I also tasted the classic milk tea hot and the jasmine milk tea with bubbles, and all I could think of was: this tastes like water with a dash of 2% milk - not even whole milk *sob*

I really don't get it. Maybe my expectations were too high. Maybe I wasn't ready for SF and the whole waiting in line down the block for food/drinks. But I was really disappointed and would never wait in line for this.
author: Tina C.

description:
Full flavored teas true to description 
Artfully presented 
The price point is on the higher end but is reflected in the product 

Overall thoughts 

A delightful boba exprience
author: Eddie W.

description:
I've been super excited to try Boba Guys since literally everyone is talking about it. It definitely lived up to the hype! Although this doesn't really pertain to me, I have to say that my friend loves boba guys because they offer oat milk, which is apparently hard to find in cafes and boba places. I got the Jasmine Milk Tea with boba pearls, 50% sweetened and it was pretty dang good. The tea was light but the actual tea aroma/flavor was pretty strong, which surprised me! The boba pearls were probably my favorite part - most places have pretty chewy/rubbery boba, but these pearls were actually soft and kind of sweet! They apparently soak them in honey? Whatever it is, I was hooked. 

Boba guys, you've sold me. I'll definitely be back to try other drinks!
author: Michael Z.

description: My first time at this location of Boba Guys wasn't great. I ordered my usual Jasmine milk tea and it didn't taste good here compared to the other locations of boba guys. But, I came back to this location a second time and I loved the customer service here and my drink was made better this time. I tried the Matchata and didn't like it so I asked if I could get the strawberry matcha instead. It was my first time trying both and I really liked the strawberry matcha! It is a tad sweet though, as you don't have the option to adjust the sweetener. Come to this location for better service compared to the one on Mission!
author: Claire Y.

description:
I am a boba fanatic. So seeing all the Boba Guys locations made me NEED to take a trip. Parking anywhere in San Francisco require luck or an nice walk to where you have to go. We went around lunchtime so there was parking two blocks away. Luckily, there wasn't a long line I've always heard about. If anything, there was only one other customer in there. 

I've always seen that cool picture of the matcha latte with strawberries. The last time I tried a matcha latte with strawberry purée, I hated it (mostly because of the texture of the strawberry purée). I made sure to read multiple reviews before actually ordering the strawberry matcha latter Boba Guys is so famous for. I was so nervous to order it because I hate being that person who tells the staff I don't like the drink and have them remake it. 

But I went for it, and TRUST, the strawberry matcha latte is freakin' delicious! Order it. Really. Just order it. It's definitely worth the hype. The strawberry purée isn't chunky, it blends well with the matcha and the milk. I normally go to a boba place multiple times to try a couple drinks before writing a review, but I was impressed with this one drink, I had to let the fellow Yelpers know what's up.
author: Remelyn S.

description:
This place has such delicious and creative bubble tea! I've been to the one on Fillmore too! Same deal, great flavors. Here I got the Ube Halaya. Ube makes a great ice cream flavor but I never tried it as a tea flavor. It was pretty good however, it could've been sweeter. I didn't know that the specialty drinks can be made sweeter so that's my fault for not telling them one hundred percent sweetened. Even still, it was really good, refreshing drink. The line can sometimes get along but I'd still wait. 
My one recommendation to the business is to train their employees in working a bit faster. Each time I've come here, the service was a bit too slow.
author: Angela L.

description:
Boba Guys is truly a lush oasis of disruptive innovation in a barren desert of archaic milk tea behemoths

Creative and colorful combinations made by bubbly baristas? They've got it down to a T! 

Ever struggled choosing a flavor? Let's be real, we all do... But now you can satisfy not one, not two, but THREE of your cravings simultaneously with the Nitro (Match, Strawberry, Oolong). Boba Guys never fails to sweeten up my day
author: Antonio C.

description: Probably one of the best boba guys locations I have been to. The area seems very new with parking available nearby. There are also a couple of tables inside, so it's a great place to study. Pretty much right next to UCSF and the line was not very long when I went.
author: Kelly C.

description:
Opens at 9AM but keep in mind that boba isn't ready til maybe 10 or 11 AM!! 

The hong kong style milk tea is made with condense milk instead of regular milk. Tastes like taiwanese milk tea where the tea flavor is heavier because it is not covered by the milk. Love it!! 

The jasmine milk tea goes so well with Egg pudding. Egg pudding is made in-house and they give you a great amount, especially if you order a large! 

This location does not have the same snacks as the other locations. They had brick toast as an option for food and some other random small to-go pre packaged snacks on the shelves. 

Parking is actually not too bad in this area if you just go one or two streets parallel to it.
author: Ivy L.

description:
A different spin from your average boba joint. Place is nice and inviting. Drinks are delicious. 

Parking can be a pain. I got the horchata which was delicious and tasted fresh!
author: Christian S.

description:
I walked here after the gym, which I sorely regretted because I got a huge blister on the balls of my feet since i was wearing sandals. 

Tmi, I know. I really wanted the matcha strawberry drink because it looks so pretty and instagrammable.  I got the strawberry matcha drink in a small size. The drinks here are priced a little more than other boba places, which is alright since they use more premium ingredients.  

I didn't think my drink was anything special though.  I might come here again to try their other drinks if i am in the area.
author: Tiffany Y.

description: If you're looking for a healthy boba drinks this is the place.  Their desserts are also good.  Parking can be hard to find.  We will definitely come back.
author: Mark R.

description:
This is the first time I've tried this chain. This location seems small, there's some seating inside, but not for a lot of people. It's bright, clean, industrial. There's a variety of drinks on the menu, but the prices are higher than average. I suppose the quality is slightly better, and the boba is soft and chewy.

I got a matcha latte with boba. Equal parts milk and matcha, it's an alright concoction. I got it less sweet, and it's not filled with ice. 

Overall, this place is okay, it's not too special to me, and it wouldn't be worth a long wait or somewhere to go out of the way for.
author: Spencer H.

description: Most boba places don't overcook their tapioca balls but Boba Guys consistently has great tapioca balls in all their locations. Most Bay Area boba places can't keep up with LA boba places but Boba Guys holds their own. They use pretty good quality of teas in their drinks. No matter which location you go to, Boba Guys just makes a consistent good boba drink.
author: Rey L.

description: I really love Boba Guys! Their drinks are high quality and you can tell they are made with real teas and natural ingredients instead of some of the lower end spots that use powders to create their drinks. I had the Jasmine Milk Tea with boba and it was delicious! You're able to select the level of sweetness which is nice. One thing that really stood out is the you can select between organic milk or two non-dairy alternatives (oat milk or almond milk) for no additional cost! I had mine with almond milk and really liked the extra flavor it added to my drink! The only downside of this spot is the lack of seating. The area has other places you can sit outside in the surrounding blocks but if the weather isn't good, you have limited options.
author: Shav S.

description:
Good quality drinks, which explains why it is on the pricer side. Their Strawberry Matcha Latte is my all time favorite. 

Got to try the Thai Milk Tea but it is lacking some favor. The Coffee Milk Tea was pretty good but couldn't really taste the coffee bc the condensed milk was overpowering the taste. Glad to be able to try new things, but will definitely stick to the Strawberry Matcha Latte.
author: Emily H.

description:
This Boba Guys location is my absolute favorite! Not only is the store clean the workers are wonderful. Stacey and Janess were caring and informative about all the drinks. They were able to recommend drinks that fit my dietary needs.


Despite it being my favorite location, I noticed the change in music. I enjoyed hearing the diversity in music that they use to play. The variety of Pop, Rap, RnB, and Spanish music was one of the few reasons why I would stay to work on school assignments. Lately I haven't been hearing the Spanish music that I admire so much since it reminded me of home. I hope they can bring it back!!
author: Oliva T.

description: My first time here at boba guys and it definitely lived up to the hype. I ordered the strawberry rice milk with boba. I liked how the strawberry purée was home made. The rest of my party ordered the muscat oolong, and jasmine milk tea. Both were also really good. You can really taste the tea. Boba guys really knows what they're doing when it comes to menu options. Would definitely recommend this place.
author: Windy M.

description:
My favorite boba place! A couple notes:

1. I've gotten there right when they open on the weekends and there's been a handful of people already there waiting (maybe 4-6ish people right when they open!). This place gets busy 
2. I tried the mochi donut and it was okay/good but it's not something I would seek out. Another time I got the custard cake and it was definitely a day old/stale. They were very responsive and refunded me for the cake but it was a slightly disappointing experience. Based on both of these things, I'll be sticking to their drinks (which I love!) and skipping the pastries (or at least asking if they were delivered today).
author: Hyan P.

description: So good. Mochi muffin and strawberry mocha latte is my fave combo. One of the best boba places world over. Can't go wrong with anything.
author: Aakash G.

description:
I'm sorry,I don't want to say this but I can't think of any boba tea I've ever had is worst than this. I was so excited to try out this place for awhile because my friend mentioned it was good and there was always a huge line. I finally tried it last night. I had a decaf black with whole milk on level 50% sweetness. I didn't have a high expectation but I was hoping it would be a descent place for boba tea. But I was really really disappointed after my first sip. 

3 reasons:

1. The milk tea was not milky at all, it tasted like either they didn't put enough whole milk in there or they used non fat milk or almond milk instead.

2. The sweetness is way too sweet for half sweetness, especially the boba are sweet as well.

3. The boba were not properly cooked or prepared, they were half raw and hard to chew. 

It made me sick the next morning because it gave me a lot of gas after I had that boba milk tea last night. Definitely not a good boba milk tea place from my experience.

I would give it 1 star, but my husband liked his lavender milk tea with 25% sweetness, I will give 1 star up. But the boba in his drink was half raw as well.
author: Choco W.

description:
Upon my first visit, I ordered a strawberry matcha latte. The boba guy (it was a guy) went "Bonnie!" And I went "oh yay that's me" and then I went up to grab it. Then POP! in goes the straw and I took my first sip without stirring the layered contents. From the bottom, I got a hit of delightfully sweet jelly jam. As I chewed the tapioca balls, I thought "dang these tapioca balls are squishy and sweet I like it". I then maneuvered the straw to the top matcha layer to have a taste of that delish liquid and YEAH it had a deep deep matcha flavor. I alternated back and forth to get the two flavors separately until I realized I should stir em both together to see how that tastes. It was a good choice. 

All in all, I rate THIS DRINK 5 stars. Yelp only lets you rate the whole place which isn't nuanced enough. I don't know how the other drinks taste but I'd definitely get the strawberry matcha latte again. I might go tomorrow actually!
author: Bonnie T.

description: I'm a huge fan of Boba Guys, and this is my favorite location because it's easy to get to, not too crowded, and easy to find parking! (Since I don't live in the city) Their interior decoration/branding aesthetic is really on point, and they have a wide variety of unique drinks. The strawberry matcha latte is beautiful and definitely worth a try, and I also really love their seasonal fruit tea frescas. Their tapioca pearls are probably my favorite out of all the boba brands I've tried, and all of their ingredients are extremely high quality and are worth the splurge!
author: Audrey G.

description:
Delicious tea for a treat-yourself day. My favorite is getting the Hong Kong style milk tea, a drink I grew up on. I also recommend trying the coffee milk tea. It's a Hong Kong style drink that's a mix of two delicious things, coffee and milk tea!! -- A good choice when you need some caffeine. I usually opt out of the boba because I used to drink boba 3X a week and found out how fattening it can be. If weight is not a concern, their boba is good! It is really filling, so it is good for an after workout treat. The Strawberry Rice Milk drink is also very good! I recommend getting all drinks iced unless it's a cold day.

There is seating inside and a park next to this location so that you can hang out with your buddies.
author: Andrea T.

description: Drinks are not good, but the store looks nice. They oddly don't accept cash. More for the eyes than the tastebuds.
author: Yong S.

description: Good drinks and the prices were very reasonable for the area, which surprised me.... But the Boba crew just wasn't that friendly. Good customer service goes a long way in the long run, especially when people risk tickets for drinks. Although the Thai tea boba was delish, I don't know if I'd return. There are other places in the area with much friendlier vibes. ‍
author: Kailee L.

description:
First found out about Boba Guys while watching a vlog on YouTube. I had been planning to check it out but never got to the last couple times I was in the Bay. We were spending the weekend in Napa, but I made sure we would stop here before we drove out. I finally got to try it out and I loved it! 

I had intended on trying the Muscat oolong, but when I got there, I saw the lavender milk tea (and I'm a sucker for lavender!) and got that. Loved the lavender milk tea! It was just the right amount of flavor -- enough to taste it, but not enough to be overpowering. I also tried the the matcha custard cake, which I wasn't expecting too much out of. First bite was okay, but it gets better with every bite. So soft and a hint of matcha flavor. I also bought a pack of lavender & coconut shortbread, which was good. I love shortbread so what more with lavender!

Once we got back to the city, we made another stop at Boba Guys before heading to the airport. This time I decided to try the Muscat oolong since the guy in the vlog raved about it. And he was right! It was delicious SO GOOD! It's so hard to describe how good it tasted. The lavender milk tea was good, but didn't set this place apart from other boba shops I've tried. But the Muscat oolong did!  All I know is I am DEFINITELY making a stop here for Muscat oolong milk tea whenever I'm in San Francisco! Wish they had this in LA so I can have my fix whenever I need it...
author: Grace T.

description:
You know, it's kind of crazy how far Boba Guys has come over the last five years.  From sharing a modest space in the Mission with Ken Ken Ramen to carrying nine locations across the Bay Area and New York?  Pretty damn impressive!  Which speaks to their obvious popularity...and how good their milk tea is!  Well, that and all of the positive reviews.  And the hype.  And the photos all over Instagram.  And the lines.  Clearly, Quickly's, this is not!

Now, when I first heard that there was a Boba Guys near my work, I knew it was only a matter of time before I found my way here.  However, that shortened up to just a couple of days when I realized they were actually just a couple of blocks away!  Surprisingly (or not so surprisingly?), there were a decent amount of people here on a random weekday afternoon.  Which actually worked out well, since it still moved decently fast while giving me time to figure out what to get from their intriguing drink selection!

-- HONG KONG STYLE MILK TEA (iced) - Black Tea Blend with Organic Condensed Milk...$4 (16oz)
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/boba-guys-san-francisco-15?select=TwX6sZYhJgF9uDzdND-R3Q)
I won't lie - the condensed milk is what really caught my eye.  Ironically though, I actually didn't taste much of it (though I did ask for 50% less sweet...).  Similarly, while the taste of the tea itself was fine, I thought the drink as a whole was a little watery, so getting "less ice" might be the way to go.

-- CLASSIC MILK TEA (Pre-bottled) - Signature Black Tea Blend with Milk - $4.50
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/boba-guys-san-francisco-15?select=WMo4qkQIYKEvmmauq8CCTg)
I'm not sure how the flavor of this compares to getting it "fresh", but it was as good as the first time I had it years ago.  Not only is the tea blend they use terrific, but I really like how balanced and flavorful the milk tea itself was - not too milky or thin nor was it abrasively sweet.

Since neither of the two drinks I tried here had toppings of any kind, I can't speak to anything other than the drinks themselves (ditto for their food offerings, which all look pretty appealing).  That being said, I do recall the boba being pretty awesome from my first ever trip to Boba Guys and I can't imagine they would have changed the formula at all (given their name and everything...).

Considering how they aren't all that far away, on top of the fact that Boba Guys are pretty much popping up everywhere, I guess I should look into investing in one of their reusable mason jars...

Cheers!
author: Mike L.

description:
I try to eat as healthy as I possibly can which means I try to avoid sugar as much as I can. However, my kryptonite is definitely bobas!  

To be quite honest, you can pretty much throw some fruits, sugar, Tapioca, and ice in a cup and I'll probably like it!  LOL!  However, the boba guys is a lot better than an average boba you'll find anywhere! For some strange reason, the bobos here taste a lot cleaner and fresher! It doesn't taste quite as sugary and artificially flavored as the other places. I'm not going to pretend like I know what's going on or what the cause of it is but I do know that it taste better than most places and it doesn't taste as unhealthy as most places!

The best part about all of this is that the price is comparable to any other boba places that you'll find in town.

Whenever I go back in town, I'll definitely try a new cup of Boba! So far, I've had five different bolt bus and I'd like them all but like I said before, I like them all!
author: Jang N.

description:
I got the strawberry matcha latte (the one with the pretty green-pink gradient that you see everywhere on IG) with almond jelly. 
PRO TIP: not only is the almond jelly actually delicious in that its soft, creamy composition compliments the sweetness of the strawberry tea, it will also make the your photo prettier as opposed to the boba lol

TLDR;

H  ella asian,
Y  ummy tea with
P  retty gradients but all at the cost of an
E  exceptionally long 30-40+ min wait

IG factor: typical (A-); take a picture at the counter and everyone will judge you. but the flooring is still great and you must take a photo of the aardvark
author: Yuuki O.

description: Great location! Line went by fast and my drink was made fast. I got the matcha latte with boba, 50% sugar. If you don't like the drink, they'll remake one for you!
author: Rose C.

description: Came here on Saturday, 29th. Boba was overcooked, and all three drinks were extremely watered down. Would've had them redo it, but they were hella busy and we weren't trying to wait. It was probably a given, when all the workers looked like they did not wanted to be there.
author: Flo F.

description: I come here often because it's close to my work. The drinks here are amazing, affordable (~$5-6 per drink), and pretty customizable: I usually order at 75% sweetness.
author: Andrew Y.

description:
Ask for the non-diary oat milk, the best! And the boba is very chewy and tasty. 

I love their matcha or strawberry-matcha bubble oat milk tea. I'd definitely recommend trying Boba Guys, just try to avoid long lines, since it might be annoying. They have multiple location around the city,  the service is fast and friendly.
author: Liza B.

description: First time coming here wasn't crowded, but the customer service sucks the girl took my order was rude she was like in a rush taking our order didn't explain much she just its sweet sweet like all the drinks. They need someone better represting this franchise I'm not even sure about going back better customer service needs to be in point and explain they menu better.
author: Hoa T.

description: I love boba guys so much! My go to orders are usually a jasmine milk tea with boba or the strawberry matcha latte! This location is pretty nice and has about 4 small tables and a large community table, plus their nitro bar! I've tried the nitro once and it was pretty good. I tried the Jasmine nitro tea which was very smooth and velvety, and if you like Jasmine tea you'll really love it. There is 4 hour street parking. What I didn't know was that they also have a bathroom... you have to ask LOL. Other than that, this location is great and the employees are nice!
author: Kimberly D.

description:
Nice location under a bunch of new apartments or condo
Pretty roomy and big, there was a good amount of seating as well

This location also offers the nitro tea but I didn't try it this time around

Street parking only

Service was pretty fast, ordered a thai tea this time around and for some reason there was a weird after taste, i've had their thai lots of time before so i thought it was odd that it had that after taste there, maybe it was not as fresh?

Overall the new store is nice and definitely would come back again to try the nitro tea
author: Michele G.

description:
This location is basically perfect!

Plentiful street parking? Check.
Seating? Check. 
Relatively short lines (even on weekends)? Check. 
Dog friendly? Check. 

There's even a dog park next door so you and your pooch can enjoy your muscat oolong or strawberry matcha latte outside, if SF weather permits of course.
author: Olivia V.

description: One of my favorite boba places! I always get the strawberry matcha latte (I tried the Strawberry Rice Milk once, and didn't like how strong the flavor of the rice milk is). It's a bit of a bummer that you can't adjust the sweetness level of specialty drinks since I think most of the drinks here are a tiny bit too sweet for my taste. The location is clean and quite aesthetic, haha, so perfect for social media photos, and the workers are always super nice!
author: Elise X.

description: I didn't want to like this place because it's so hyped up, but I find myself grabbing the Strawberry Matcha with boba at least once every two weeks! If you work in the area, take advantage of the neighborhood discount...I use that discount as an excuse to order a large. I've ordered some of the other items off their menu, but I'm a loyal hoe for the Strawberry Matcha...I just really enjoy how the strawberry's tartness cuts through that bitter creamy matcha. And don't get me started on the boba...I've never enjoyed having balls in my mouth so much.
author: Charissa S.

description: First time try the" Green Tea Latte " and fall in love with it! Love this place so much,customer services and the drink quality were excellent! Keep it up!
author: Joyce L.

description:
So I normally get the strawberry matcha latte at boba guys and I absolutely love it.

For this location, I tried the HK milk tea and the coffee milk tea, so I'm not sure if this location sucks at making those drinks or if Boba Guys sucks at making those drinks. Too sweet (75%) and too thin in consistency. I suspect it's the lack of evaporated milk and not straining the tea enough that led to my disappointment with the Hong Kong milk tea.

Eh.

The lines are way shorter. Maybe I'll come back to get a strawberry matcha latte to have a constant variable. You know, for science.
author: Trang B.

description: No wait !! I usually go to the one near Chinatown and that one is so annoying. There's a line even before they open. If you have a car I would just drive to this location because it's literally no wait. And it's just a nicer location. There's chairs and tables and you can sit down and chat.
author: Marlana Y.

description:
Great drinks as usual, awesome location right in Potrero Hill, and fun vibe. They have some nitro options for a pretty similar price than the regular.

Two things to keep in mind: no boba until 11am and the lids used for hot drinks are made of a hard plastic that doesn't bend as easily. Ended up flicking liquid on myself several times when I tried to drink from the lid.
author: Jennifer D.

description: Got the strawberry matcha latte with boba that you see everywhere. It was pretty good, although I did think the strawberry was a little overwhelming and masked the matcha flavor a bit. The ingredients did taste super fresh though, especially the tapioca which were nice and soft. We went around 6 on a weekday, and it wasn't crowded at all! I would assume this is one of the less crowded locations. Parking around the area was plentiful- we found parking right near the intersection of 7th and 16th. They also have a restroom outside- just ask for the key fob!
author: Rosy L.

description:
Great location (a little too easy for me to get to as well).
I have yet to check out the rest of the menu as I am kind of stuck on the matcha strawberry. The boba today was especially soft and sweet. I think they had just finished whipping up the batch? I saw two giant pots on the stove cooking.
I also ordered the classic boba milk tea normal sweet for my son. Their sweet is WAY sweet so next time I'll just order less sugar.
author: Liz N.

description:
Finally this place was open on a weekend. When I use to work in Mission Bay, it was an idea of a friend and mine to open a boba place. Looks like we should of. 

Drinks taste like all Boba Guys drinks, but the interior of this one is much bigger than the one in the Mission, which I do really like. There's still not that much seating though. The whole place can maybe seat 10 people? The wait was kinda long for how short the line was, but they're still working out the kinks, so I'm sure it'll be quicker hopefully soon. Anyways, this area has been in a need for a bubble tea place and I'm glad there finally is one.
author: Julie L.

description: Living in LA, I've always heard of friends from SF raved about Boba Guys. Finally I got to try it when I visited. As expected, there was a line when we arrived. The line went by pretty fast and we got to order drinks within 10-15 min. I got their matcha latte with boba and my BF got their matcha latte with strawberry puree. We both got 50% sweet but it was still way too sweet for us. However I did enjoy the matcha latte with strawberry puree. The strawberry puree created this sourness which surprisingly balanced the creaminess and sweetness of matcha latte very well. Also when it comes to boba, I am all about the texture of tapioca and their boba was super chewy and sweet. Also I love whatever milk they use for latte, it was super rich and tasty! Will def come back when I am in the area.
author: Yushan W.

description:
Fast and friendly service! Clean and not crowded like all other locations.

Bonus: open on Monday unlike other locations 

Tip: no boba until 11am :(

Picture: caramel matcha latte, chocochata, horchata with organic chia seeds.

The caramel matcha latte had too much caramel. Adjustments would cost $1.50
author: Jenny C.

description:
When you move into a new neighborhood, or start a new job, some things a high priority - among those is finding your best local boba place.  Boba guys has been pretty good to me here - I have to give credit to them for balancing offering traditional drink choices along with more inventive, unique offerings.

Their menu has a wide range of interesting flavors, that I might call hit or miss.  Some, like the chocochata, sound great on paper but are a bit light on flavor.  Other drinks like the strawberry matcha latte are good, but seem a bit more designed for instagram and maybe a bit overhyped.  I see not a lot of love in the reviews for my actual favorite - the Purple Rain.  This drink has a great balance of sweetness and tartness, is packed with berry goodness and feels worth its price in produce.  For a cafe-type place that has both drinks and baked goods, I'd have to say the baked goods seem almost like an afterthought.  The mochi muffins are well-baked, but experience of these, and probably most of their baked goods would be enhanced if they offered to warm these up for you.  A gooey, chewy, warm mochi muffin is comforting and addictive - a cold one is alright, but forgettable.  I also think some of the baked goods are not great value, with some of the steepest priced pineapple cakes I've ever seen ($5)
author: Neal B.

description:
OMG. I can not get enough of their OAT MILK!!!

This location is prime considering there are not much stores around this area.. Since I work nearby, I always walk over to boba guys on my break. Their staff are always friendly and their service is always amazing!! 

I always get the jasmine milk tea with oat milk. I have never tried oat milk until boba guys. It might sound weird but its a tastier and healthier alternative than milk. The consistency of oat milk is very light and refreshing. Unlike milk, its heavy and filling. I would highly recommend oat milk to those who want a new twist to their drink.
author: Jenny S.

description: They say that trends come back in cycles, but did boba ever really leave? Gone are the days of Tapioca Express where the biggest decision you had to make was whether you're getting boba in a drink or not. Enter Boba Guys that caters to everything an SF foodie enthusiast would want: organic and housemade milks, enough matcha combinations to turn you green (literally?), and Instagrammable drinks to make all your friends/followers envious. After avoiding the lines at their other spots, I finally bit the bullet and stopped in to their newest place in Potrero. I went with their Black Sesame Latte with boba. After many many many years of not having boba, I can confirm that I'm still in fact a fan. I will definitely be back to try the next concoction - I've got my eye on that Strawberry Matcha!
author: Lisa I.

description:
# 15 Boba Guys *Rod Boba SF Rating * 5/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars

Of all the boba guys in the city I like this location the best. I got the standard milk tea with boba and it was pretty good. I enjoyed how they asked me if the ice level was good enough for me (the little things do matter).  Not a huge boba guys fan however for taste they land squarely in the median range of my SF boba rankings below which makes them a solid option if I'm close by but not something I'd go out of my way for.


# 15 Boba Guys *Rod Boba SF Rating * 5/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars

Rod M tours San Francisco in search of the BEST standard milk tea with boba. I have individual reviews for all the places listed below.  Check out my latest reviews for the most up to date list. 

I recently embarked on a completely pointless quest to rank most of the Milk Tea/Boba Places in the area.

Rules: I ordered a simple milk tea with Boba (regular sweetness, ice etc.)

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #38  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

Rod Boba SF Rating = (Taste of Milk Tea / Taste of Tapioca Balls) on a Scale of 1 to 10 (10/10) being the best score possible
* Please note that I like my boba a little bit sweet. I don't like it too milky, too strong of a tea taste or too watery.  I prefer fresh tasting larger "boba".  Powdery drinks (those places that simply have a plastic carafe that they pour out of ) and boba that tastes "old" get docked on my rating scale.
