author: Rod M.

description: Obsessed! This is also my favorite location because easy parking, friendly and high energy service, and a restroom you can use!!! What to try? Everything. Of course gotta try Strawberry Match Latte and for food...Mochi Muffin!
author: Sharon Q.

description:
Visited boba guys recently for the first time and it was a mixed experience. The locations for boba guys are great as they're generally located in up and coming areas with some street parking. 

I liked the organization, cleanliness, and unique specials that they offered. There were some that were great alternatives to the traditional boba milk tea experience as seems to be their mantra.  I didn't try their famed drink, the matcha with strawberry which was surprisingly delightful but odd at the same time. I didn't love it enough to order to every time but I definitely enjoyed it enough to keep drinking it.  Tried the almond milk tea, which was okay - wasn't blown away by the tea flavor or the almond flavor. As for the actual boba, it was good, not amazing; nicely cooked but nothing special.  Also tried the topping of grass jelly and it was subpar to say the least, felt like it came straight out of a can, it was hard and just plain.  

I did speak to a couple of friends and they recommended the black sesame latte so I'll definitely try that next.
author: Amanda L.

description: My GF is a boba fanatic and she's been wanting to try Boba Guys since we were in SF last year. We finally got a chance to check them out. The line was out the door and it wasn't moving very fast. Once we placed our order, it took about 10min to get our drinks. I got their Strawberry Green Tea with boba. I am not a fan of boba but the ones they make here are chewy and sweet. The texture is definitely a lot more different that other boba places. As for the dirnk itself, it was really good and not overly sweet. I get the hype now.
author: Juan F.

description:
I'm a milk tea addict. It's truly my drink of choice and I've been to many boba tea shops in my lifetime.

Getting to the point... Boba Guys is hands down one of my all-time favorite milk tea/boba shops. 

Why I LOVE Boba Guys:
- They use premium, natural, organic ingredients
- Like a BOSS they make everything in-house and from scratch (rice milk, almond jelly, grass jelly)
- If you're a fan of black sesame, you MUST order their Black Sesame Latte specialty drink. (Note: The Union Square location doesn't have this flavor)
- Their milk options don't discriminate from those with dietary restrictions. They have quite the selection and from fancy and top brands: Straus Family Organic Milk, Califia Farms Almond Milk, Organic Soymilk, Oatly Oat Milk. (My personal favorite is the Oatly Oat Milk!)
- Most of their drinks are customizable in sweetness and ice level.
- Unique flavors like horchata, Hojicha, Chamomile Milk, Strawberry Matcha
- The entire store is IG-worthy, including their Strawberry Matcha drink (trust me on this--it's gorgeous and makes you not want to mix the vibrant colors)

Too bad I live in LA and so far from the SF and NY locations. It's no joke that I'm always craving a refreshing and satisfying drink from them. Last time I was in SF I visited two days in a row and it left me wanting more.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
The trick to loving Boba Guys is simply knowing what to order!! They give you so many options,  it's really difficult for people like me to know how to not screw it up!

Here's a couple helpful hints if you need help deciding...
1. Strawberry Matcha Latte - this is one of the ones they're really known for, but if you don't like Matcha green tea..you should probably steer clear!
2. Horchata Milk tea with Almond Jelly (but don't order this if you don't like Horchata!!)

Pretty intuitive advice, no? Well, fine!..i guess I'm not as smart as you!!

Other honorable mentions:
- Their Dirty horchata
- Coffee Milk Tea
- Classic Black Milk Tea

It's also worth mentioning that they offer 3 different varieties of milk - oat milk, regular milk and almond milk! Awesome for all you lactose people out there!!
author: Jennifer S.

description: Tried Boba Guys for the first time and have to say I was very impressed. Got the Lychee Green tea and it was delicious. Will for sure be coming back for more and to try other things on the menu.
author: Roman L.

description:
I used to dislike Boba Guys, but now that there's a store downstairs and I've had the chance to try out some of their other drinks, I can happily say that Boba Guys is one of my favorite bubble tea places in SF!

My go-to drink here is the Jasmine Milk Tea with Boba, Default Milk (Half and Half I believe), and 50% sweetness. I've also tried the Strawberry Matcha Latte and the Taro Smoothie, but the Jasmine Milk Tea is what keeps me coming back. I love that the boba here is chewy and soft - I haven't found anywhere else that makes such good bubbles!

The service here is pretty fast on weekday evenings - I usually only have to wait 2-3 minutes for my drink to be prepared.

Note that if you live in the apartment complex Potrero 1010, you can get a 10% neighborhood discount.
author: Yuan J.

description: My horchata was watered down. We did come in 15 minutes before closing but 15 minutes is ample time to make a good tasting drink. Otherwise, the location is bigger than most others and there wasn't a line when we went. We got some free stickers as well. They are starting to sell merch which is pretty cool. There's a cute black unisex shirt that says "Boba Bae" for $20.
author: Kathy H.

description:
UGH. You guys. When you're in Cleveland and type "bubble tea" in Yelp, you maybe get one result that's cities away. When you type this in in San Francisco, there's bubble tea everywhere. Next door! Around the corner! You're actually in one right now! Okay, maybe that last part is an exaggeration, but you catch my drift.

With that in mind... Boba Guys doesn't disappoint. I've had my fair share of bubble tea around SF, and Boba Guys continue to kill it as one of my favorites. Not only have they catered my work functions on several functions, but I finally had the opportunity to stop into this location. I love, love, love their menu. The iced Classic Milk Tea is my favorite, but I've tried the Horchata and Jasmine Milk as well, and they all rule. Love that they pride themselves on using organic ingredients and as they say, "Grade A Balls" (get your mind out of the gutter). Great tea, cool space, nice people. There's not much to dislike about Boba Guys.
author: Lauren K.

description:
i know there's a lot of hype for this place, but it's definitely on point.

i got the rose black tea with milk and half sweetness- perfect tea taste. and the boba is definitely the best i've ever had, and this is coming from someone who frequents socal boba spots.

i'm excited to try their LA location! :)
author: Tamara A.

description:
So I would give this 1 star but I actually like boba guys.

So here's my riff, I came to Boba Guys to get my boba fix. A young lady yells out "Hello! Could you wait a min?" I gladly replied "Sure!" So I waited for about 5 mins and she proceeded to take my order. 

I ordered 2 strawberry matcha and the young lady says "we don't serve boba until 11" I looked down at my watch and it was 10:52 and pulled out my iPhone to double check and yup 10:53. I then stated it's 10:53? She responds with "do you want to wait????" Flabbergasted by the statement I just said YES! It's really the only reason I came here, you guys are called "BOBA GUYS" .. 

I own my own business so I get protocols but even this was a little ridiculous.
author: Rio J.

description:
Came here for the first time and love their Boba drink. 

On my first day, I ordered (special drink) Matchella (Topping: boba). I requested no ice but they told me it will not have the good looking color for the drink (green color at the top and pink color at the bottom). So, I ordered a less ice one instead. It taste more like a mixture of matcha + fruity flavor. It was a little sour. The boba is extremely chew, definitely high quality and I like it! Def love their boba more than the drink.

I came back again to order another special drink, Mango Matcha Tea Fresca (Topping: homemade almond jelly). It doesn't taste like Matcha but more fruity flavor. The almond jelly taste pretty good.

I feel like most of their drink has a fruity flavor more than tea flavor, which I don't mind.   

I definitely will come back again to try other drink. The price for each boba drink costs more than an average boba drink should be but why not give it a try :-). 

The line can be pretty long and there's only one cashier available -- a good sign that people love this place :-). If you don't mind waiting, it will usually be around 15 minutes.
author: Evelin F.

description:
Finally a Boba Guys near my work. Aside from the standard drink menu, I love how they have drinks that are seasonal and could change every week. All the drinks are very well made and the baristas are making them in a heart beat. Can't find a fault even if I wanted to.

My go to is the Strawberry Matcha Latte!
author: Brian L.

description: This is my favorite boba place in SF. I recommend their matcha series! Matchella I got today had in-house raspberry/pineapple purée, and it was a good balance of sweet and tangy. Still, my favorite is the strawberry matcha! There's a decent amount of indoor seating, but due to the popularity of boba guys, it becomes packed pretty quickly. It's more of a quick stop-and-go type of place. There's no public restroom!
author: Hailey K.

description: the past 2 times i've been,  i did not ask for toppings and both times they automatically added boba as a topping to my order. of course i should have checked my order but who has time to read all that? they also dont mention it when they read it out. if i ask for them to remake it, they will but that 50 cents is still charged.... #schemingonthelow #watchout
author: Lydia Z.

description:
The Potrero Hill Boba Guys is new and do not a lot of people know about it, which means shorter lines! I came here on a Sunday afternoon, on a nice day too, and waited only about 4 minutes. Tried the jasmine milk tea with boba, which I hadn't tried before. It was a little too milky, which is common with jasmine teas. I usually get either the Hong Kong milk tea or the matcha milk tea. Both are exceptional. The boba here is always fresh and perfect too.

Highly recommended.
author: Billy S.

description: This place is gooooooood! I ordered the dirty Horchata and it was so yummy!  I will come back here.  The site looked clean, a lot of light coming in very open and pleasant.  The staff was nice and cool!  I got my drink super fast but then again there was only 1 other person ahead of me.  They have cool stuff for sale, like mason jar cups and other Boba guys stuff.  They have plenty of seating and the lighting is good. This place is right by my work, a few blocks so I will continue to come here.  The prices are fair, probably what you would pay everywhere else.  You should come get your Boba fix here, its worth it!
author: Alexandra L.

description:
This one is one of the nicer Boba Guys! It has tables and a nice little bar area to sit, chat or do work. Honestly though, with the constant flow of people coming in, I don't think of this as a go-to study place. It's just too crowded! But they can't help it, Boba Guys is one of San Francisco's treasures~ 
Love the decor in here from the cute stickers on the walls to the neat Nitro neon light! Definitely need to try that nitro one day, but I can't help but order a strawberry matcha milk tea every time I stop by. That drink is just tooo guuud!! Also, for some reason, this location in particular always has a bunch of cute puppies coming through! Uguu~
author: Kim N.

description: Boba guys is the best of the best.  By this I mean that their drinks are free of artificial ingredients and they never use powders.  Their products are created only from the best ingredients they could source. From their Grade A balls to their hand-shaken froth, they put care, thought and an immense amount of love into every aspect of their drinks.  They also allow you to adjust sweetness and ice.  You can't go to San Francisco without going here.
author: Ghazal S.

description: I was expecting the boba here to blow my mind as this chain seems to be super popular now. I ordered a regular-sized strawberry matcha latte with pearls. I think the drink looks pretty snapchat-worthy and it did taste just okay. I think for $5.50 is a little steep for what I ordered. The ambiance of the place is super cute and the customer service was friendly. I probably wouldn't come out of my way to go this boba spot, but I'd be willing to try another drink.
author: Joanne Y.

description: I tried their Jasmine milk tea with pudding and boba.   The boba is nice and chewy.  The pudding was too stiff.   I've never seen pudding that stiff at any boba places.  It was so stiff and hard to suck up the straw.  I had pudding and boba shooting up into my throat and choked a few times because the pudding was stiff.   Seriously... this pudding is not for kids.
author: Angel Q.

description:
Boba Guys has been my favorite milk tea place ever since I had it for the first time years ago! I love that they have so many locations now and still keep up with the consistent quality and service! This location is just as good as the others I've tried. 
My go-to is the matcha latte with almond milk at 75% sweetness. I'm lactose intolerant so I always love a place that does good non-dairy milk teas. They have tons of tea options here and allow customization of your drinks! They use high-quality ingredients and you can taste the difference!
I used to be a fan of the horchata. It's really good but there isn't a non-dairy option. I also really like the earl grey with almond milk! A lot of people like the strawberry matcha latte. It just tastes like strawberry milk to me so I prefer the regular matcha latte.
author: Emily L.

description:
Boba guys re ignited my love and fire for boba. 

I used to love boba but then I kept getting boba that would get hard and nasty so I stopped enjoying boba until I came here. 

I love everything about this place to the boba itself to the interior decorations. It's so aesthetically pleasing inside and it makes it so inviting. 

The boba and drinks itself are sooooo good. I like how you can choose your level of sweetness. I like my drinks really sweet and being able to choose how sweet you want it is just a plus. I order the coffee milk tea and it was the perfect amount of sweetness. Usually when I drink coffee I get headaches, but with boba guys I didn't experience any at all. The drinks themselves taste really clean and refreshing.

One downfall of this place is the amount of time it takes to get drinks... the line isn't that long and they take quite awhile for drinks to come out. I remember ordering after a specific couple and we thought our drinks would be next but the person who ordered after us got their drinks before us. 
That's the only downfall but other than that, amazing drinks and atmosphere!
author: Jinthana S.

description: This place is very aesthetic, fast service, kind employees, and the drinks were great, just wished that they would take cash
author: Sarah N.

description: I've been a long time fan since 2013 visiting the 19th street location. This location is perfect for me because I can find parking easy and it's on my way home from work.
author: San F.

description:
Finally! A Boba Guys joint that is close to me with okay parking nearby. I like that they use real tea leaves instead of concentrates. That said, in comparison to TPumps et al, I think the drinks here are a little bland (I've had the jasmine, HK style and matcha). I guess you can't have it both ways. 

I've also tried the kaya toast, which I'll skip in the future. They use challah from wise sons, which is a nice idea and generally delicious, but challah doesn't have the same texture and milky flavor that comes from Taiwan toast (which I think uses milk powder in the dough). I think maybe if they doused the challah in butter first, the concept would work better.
author: Jean L.

description:
If you're ever so lucky to be here for the seasonal raspberry pineapple Fresca tea, it is sooo good. So refreshing and the grass jelly complimented it so well. 

We came about 10 minutes before opening and we were the first ones in line but a few minutes later there was already a line forming. Service took a little longer than your normal bubble tea shop but it is well worth the hype.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Worst coffee outside of The Mission but my kids said the Boba was OK, not as good as Quikly though.
author: Adrian J.

description: There is a lesson to be learned here: not every long line ends in a yummy eat or drink.  The boba here is too sweet and the tea is dull. If you wanna have a proper boba drink I would suggest qualitea or steap tea bar.
author: Adar G.

description:
This Boba Guys location is so quiet and modern, I love it! 

It's gonna be hard to miss. We drove right past it, and thought it was some sort of gentrified shop in the warehouses. It's unmarked, in the retail below the new and modern condominiums. 

Street parking is street parking, but on the weekend, there is plenty in Mission Bay. We parked across the street where the off-white warehouses are.

It's not busy here, but that's what I like (that's what I like). Though there was a line, it was short and quick. We hogged the counter seats where they do the nitro brew stuff, I think. I love the vibe here. 

As for the boba, I decided to try the Hong Kong milk tea, for the first time ever. Probably not my favorite. I didn't know it was condensed milk in it, so it was super sweet. My friend pushed me to ask for more tea, but I hate doing stuff like that. LOL, so I told her to do it, and they were nice about it and added more black tea. It was a little better, but for personal preference, I don't like condensed milk with my tea -- only Vietnamese coffee.

I got the infamous strawberry matcha latte to-go for the bf. I've been warming him up to boba, so I thought that this drink would be best for him (he likes fruity boba). I brought it to San Jose, and it was still good quality! But, neither of us were a fan of this drink. Pretty drink, but not for us.

Oh, also they have some off-menu toast! Maybe ask the cashier what they have to offer.

Next time, I'll stick to my regular black milk tea.
author: Nicole D.

description:
DUDE WHY DOES THIS PLACE HAVE SO MUCH HYPE?!?!?? Boba Guys are probably the most popular boba place and I don't know why! "Taste our Grade A balls" NO THANKS THEY SUCK! 

Okay... maybe I should back it up a little bit. So I had scoured SF for the best boba place around and found myself here. When we went in, I could already feel that nice hipster vibe, and was enjoying myself. And then we ordered our drinks... and things went downhill from there. I ordered the Jazzcat with no milk, my mom ordered the Lychee Rose with no milk, and my dad originally wanted the Taro Smoothie, but figured it had milk. He asked anyways though. Here's how our cashier responded, "Oh, well we make our Taro smoothie with rice milk and only an ounce of regular milk." My dad asked if he could just have a smoothie with all rice milk, but the cashier refused and insisted on having an ounce of milk in the drink. Finally, my dad gave up and changed his order to a Jasmine Green Tea without milk. 

After 5 minutes of waiting, we finally got our drinks. One problem: my Jazzcat and my mom's Lychee Rose had been made with milk. *facepalm* so we told them that we had ordered without milk and had them make it again, which took another 5 minutes or so. Then they finally got us the drinks.

The Jazzcat was decent, the tea was very fragrant and I could taste the flowery jasmine along with the sweet muscat. The boba, however, was subpar and was hard and had a weird aftertaste.

The Lychee Rose was pretty good too and had a nice fragrant rose taste, along with a fruity Lychee undertone. Again, the boba was rock solid.

The Jasmine green tea was good too and had that nice jasmine flavor. I think I could get one just as good anywhere else, though. Anyways, the boba in that was hard, and I regret not ordering an almond jelly in mine.

Overall, my experience at Boba Guys wasn't too great, and I'm sure that I could get WAY better boba tea in SF elsewhere. If you're craving boba, I'd recommend Mr. and Mrs. Tea, because their boba isn't hard like Boba Guys was.
author: Ella W.

description: If you like milk tea/boba tea then this place is definitely worth a visit. Lots of different styles of tea on the menu along with lots of options to customize. You can choose toppings ranging from tapioca balls, almond jelly, to organic chia seeds. Pick from almond, oat, and regular milk. Lots of options. They also serve a couple drinks on nitro tap which rotates. If tea isn't your thing they do have some other options like horchata and standard coffee/expresso. It's a small location so not much room to sit but there is a little park/green space right next door. Street parking can be tricky during the week but pretty easy on the weekend. It's common to see a line out the door but I will say the staff are pretty solid and the wait typically isn't that bad. Got a boba milk tea craving check this place out
author: Peter P.

description: There are few places I'd wait in a line as long as the one outside Boba Guys. We walked up to a slew of people lined up all the way outside the door. Luckily we didn't let that deter us, we needed our boba. The line moves pretty fast and once you get inside you're met with the friendliest of faces and great music. Quickly after ordering our drinks were made so the wait turned out to be not so bad. I had their strawberry matcha latte (with almond milk) and the chocochata, both with tapioca balls. They were absolutely delicious. The matcha latte was a perfect blend of matcha with fresh strawberries and the chocochata was full of chocolatey and cinnamon flavor. So while he line can be intimidating Boba Guys is well worth the wait!
author: Angela D.

description: When they say they take boba to the next level they ain't lying! I absolutely recommend their strawberry matcha latte for all you matcha and strawberry lovers! Their boba had the right chewiness and sweetness to it to make it perfect! I am also a mochi lover so I decided to try their mochi muffin. Not a fan of the seeds on top but a huge fan of the muffin overall chewy and delicious in my opinion! When I comeback to the city boba guys is a must go to!
author: Drea R.

description: Boba guys is for sure one of my favorite bubble tea places in SF. Growing up in Japan, I have super high standards for matcha and the matcha latte here definitely makes the cut. I love that they use authentic matcha powder and whisks it by hand. This location is perfect as I live right next door - the interior and atmosphere is super cute and relaxing. For the longest time, I was hesitant about trying their popular strawberry matcha latte since I've never seen that combination before, but I'm so glad I tried it because it's now one of my favorite drinks. The strawberry purée adds just a subtle hint of strawberry flavor that blends well with the matcha. It was such a pleasant surprise. So excited to keep trying the other flavors they have!
author: Mika N.

description:
Love the Boba tea. 

However, extremely disappointed by the kaya toast. It might have NOT meant to be authentic ..... Because it was far from it. The toast was from Wise Sons, it tasted great, but very thick. The most disappointing thing is that the so called kaya tasted more like custard. No coconut taste, and it was not green neither. Kaya is meant to be from kaya jam, which is made of pandan which gave the color green.

If you want a tasty toast, sure, it is a 4-star toast. But 1 star for being called kaya toast. 

p.s. I grew up in Singapore, where kaya toast originated...
author: Anonymous L.

description:
Yum! First time here. There was a line which honestly was a good sign for me. I ordered the Matcha Latte with tapioca balls at 50% sweetness. It was so amazing and kept me buzzing for the rest of the day.

The place itself was also visually pleasing. Very light and open! Would go back a million times.
author: Faith R.

description: I randomly encountered this boba spot while walking after dinner. The place itself was cute and modern. They had an interesting menu to choose from. I ordered the lavender milk tea with less sugar and it was super good. You could definitely taste the lavender. My friend ordered the strawberry matcha milk tea and thought it was too sugary. I would come back when I am in the city again.
author: Jennifer T.

description: If you have some brown blood aching for that ube halaya.... Just don't. Tasted watered down with something grainy... Oh that's the coconut bits.  Good thing the boba has good texture and flavor.  If you want purple sugar water with grits, ube halaya is drink of choice. I'll be getting taro  milk next time I want a satisfying purple beverage.
author: Chi H.

description:
Strawberry matcha latte is refreshing and unique. I was expecting fake strawberry flavor but you can really taste the fresh strawberry and matcha in this. Swirl and you're good to go!

Coconut tea latte is deliciously coconutty although bordering on the too sweet side.

I normally judge boba places by their regular black milk tea and boba. The Black milk tea and boba is pretty good, nothing mind blowing though. Boba has good consistency and is fresh and chewy. I usually get it half sweetened. 

I'd be back to try some of the other unique options but wasn't blown away by their standard milk teas.

I wish they had Sunday Bird and fried chicken treats like the Fillmore location as well. 

It's so nice to have a boba place nearby in the Potrero area though!
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Happy to come across Boba Guys in Potrero Hills. Beautiful modern space with a constant flow of people. 

I tried the black sesame latte with bobas and it was good! Nice and nutty like sesame ice cream.
author: Lis A.

description: I've been to this location 20 times or so. It's overrated and overhyped. There's a 25% chance of them getting your order wrong. Prices are high. You will most likely wait in an outdoor queue. Some of the drinks taste OK but none are worth the price. Just don't.
author: Andrew F.

description:
Came in on a Thursday afternoon for their soft opening and received 10% off (until April 15). As a loyal customer- I come at least twice a week - I had to check out their new location!  The interior is like any other boba guys with 3 or so tables inside. 

Drink: 
-Strawberry matcha latte with either soy or almond milk and I usually add boba and/or almond jelly - best drink on the menu forsure

Parking: 
-lots of street parking 


Please open one up in the sunset!
author: Daniel S.

description: This had a high rating while I was researching stuff to do in San Francisco! We came pretty late a little right before closing, but it was still hustling and bustling which is awesome to see when you're coming into a boba shop! The drinks were very interesting to look at and tasted awesome! thanks for an awesome visit we will be back the next time we fly in!
author: Charlie D.

description: I frequent between this location and the one in Fillmore for their decaf black milk tea with fresh milk and boba. Not too many locations offer decaf so its pretty nice to find one with a lot of options. friendly staff, on point boba. Pricing is slightly higher than the norm but worth it because of the quality of the tea.
author: Tao Tao W.

description: Ordered a Ube Boba however got nothing but coconut milk so disappointed!!! So I went to MilkBomb down the road and added a scoop of Ube ice cream #winning !
author: Rebecca M.

description: This location seems less busy than the others in sf (I'd say mission is the worst though the filmore can get pretty bad). I always get the same drink, the machata- matcha + horchata. The drink is around $5 without boba for the smallest size which is pretty expensive for boba. The flavors are interesting so it's worth going for the eccentric flavors. Their milk tea and Thai tea aren't that great however, and I would recommend walking to sf spark social food trucks, which is 7 min away, to get the OG boba flavors for cheaper and tastier.
author: Kalani R.

description:
Very clean and cozy place! The drinks are always good  but too bad the strawberry matcha latte can't be adjusted for sweetness :( so I ended up getting the jasmine green tea with aloe jelly 25% sweet. I loved it! Next time I'll try it with their boba.

The restrooms are two doors down and you ask for a key. They get quite popular throughout the day but the wait isn't too long. I love the atmosphere :)
author: Amy H.

description:
Nice addition to an upcoming area. Asked the cashier for a recommended and she suggested matcha latte with boba. I was worried it would taste too much like brewed tea and I have a sweet tooth so I picked 100% sweetness.  The drink is delicious once you've mixed all three layers together but it's a bit on the pricey side; $5 for a small and $6 for a large. 

My husband is a big coffee drinker and really liked the coffee milk tea. You can tell they use higher quality tea leaves and coffee beans in their drinks.
author: CL S.

description: BLAH very very very bland...wont be back...this is just a trendy spot and thats it...i'll go to quicklys
author: Jenny P.

description:
My order was incorrect, missing grass
Jelly but was charged for it.. He also forgot to give me my custard but luckily I remember when I got to the car and walked back for it. My first time at the Potrero location. Disappointed
author: Whitney N.

description: I know the boba craze is real in SF, but it's unclear to me why people love boba guys. I know the logo is cute, the stores are / can be cute, but to me, the drinks are just okay. They're not particularly good, nor are they particularly bad. However, I personally don't see what why people love them so much and that they have so many stores around SF o.O
author: Jade F.

description:
I don't remember the service when I've gone here in the past. They are pretty busy, so my guess is they were being efficient and nothing stood out as outstanding or bad - and yes there is usually a line out the door. If you want prompt coffee I would go elsewhere. This location is very clean, with some places to sit (but not relaxing, and leave your computer at home). The interior is great, they take pride in their small chain of stores around the Bay Area, and it shows.

Love their specialty drinks with balls. You can't really go wrong with balls, but these are especially good. My personal favorite is the dirty chai latte, but make sure you request the balls as none of the drinks include them by default.

Im not a big fan of their coffee by itself, and their balls aren't ready until 11am, so my personal recommendation is to wait until 11 or later. I wasn't impressed with the food (there's only 2 options i believe, both toast with ingredients on them. One of them was alright, but i probably wouldn't order either again). due to the amount of time it takes to wait in line and order, Its more of an experience best done with friends while walking around Potrero. Lots of people out walking dogs nearby too!
author: Brian H.

description:
I've been to the boba guys in the mission plenty of times but there is something special about this store in Potrero. Not only is this store bigger, but it is evident that the workers all get along and enjoy their job. They also had great music taste so that's always a plus. 
I had a good experience with one worker who I believe is named Bryan. He offered a friendly smile and answered any questions I had. He helped me decide on which drinks I should get based off my preference but also his without forcing any drink on me. He was very patient considering how indecisive I am. So thanks Bryan for that! ^.^
The drinks I got were Strawberry Matcha Latte and the Jasmine Milk Tea. Both tasted fantastic and fresh and I am definitely coming back here again.
author: Catherine C.

description:
I'm a long time Boba Guys fan and was super excited to find out that they opened a Potrero Hill location! Staff is friendly and the boba is top notch as usual. 

Although it's seasonal I highly recommend the Tropic Thunder. It's really delicious and dairy free (I'm lactose)! But if they do t have it, my go to is the Coconut Green Tea with oat milk and boba. 

I'm not sure if it's only this location, but they have aloe jelly too as a topping! 

The store itself isn't too big, but definitely bigger than the Mission location. There's plenty of outdoor seating nearby even if it's full. 

Overall 5 stars!
author: Kelly D.

description: Their strawberry rice milk is seriously good. I think about it regularly. I do wish the line was a little bit more orderly - there's not really a place for people to exit without having to dodge around other people.
author: Christina S.

description: This place is BOBAMAZING!!!!!!! We celebrated our friends birthday here and we had such a great time !!! Thanks boba guys !!!!
author: Connie C.

description:
Updating my review to 5 stars after getting the jasmine milk tea with tapioca balls. My last review was 3 stars purely because the Hong Kong style was so terrible. This location has it all: ample street parking, no line, ample seating, and aesthetics.

I highly recommend the Jasmine milk tea. The Hong Kong style was honestly terrible, I couldn't finish the drink.

Their hours are a bit shorter due to the nature of their location, but there is never a line at this location. The service is excellent and quick. If you want to go to a Boba Guys where you can always find parking and you never have to wait in a line, this is it!
author: Jen S.

description:
Seriously top notch boba and milk tea! The line is very long during the weekends and prime hours but goes through fairly quickly. It's definitely worth the wait. It's the only boba place in the neighborhood and is top notch quality.

Sometimes you can see the owners at the shop. They're super open to talking and meeting. Very great management and staff!
author: Sophia W.

description:
Service, on point. Friendly. Longish line but pretty short wait. And the people who work here (each time I've gone) are all kind of attractive. Yowz!

Duke of Earl Grey with Almond milk, 50% sweet and boba. It's my go-to, for a good time.
author: Andrew L.

description:
A lot of love for Boba Guys and I'm glad they're opening up new locations.  While it's sort of convenient of a location, why did it have to be right between 2 Caltrain stops...  Similar interior to their other locations, this one does provide a bit more seating than most which is great.  They have a small bar area set up for those who want to try some Nitro Tea, which I highly suggest you do if you're here.  It's great, and doesn't cost that much more than the regular milk teas.  I'm a little concerned with the quality here compared to the other stores as the coconut green tea I had was a bit different from the other locations I've had it at.  It was much more floral for some reason and I guess it had a bit too much sweetener inside.  Still good, but maybe they're still working out the kinks here.  I love the Nitro Tea here and hope they expand it to their other stores soon, that stuff is so incredibly smooth and refreshing!  Also, while I spent a while waiting in line here, the drinks came out incredibly fast compared to their other locations, so just an observation there.

Pros:
-Nitro Tea Bar
-Serves Pastries and snacks
-Decent amount of seating (if not there is a park right outside with benches too)
-Quality Boba of course.

Cons:
-The location is a bit far to walk to from Caltrain in the blazing sun, but it's still worth it.
author: Bryson L.

description: I love their jasmine green milk tea and coffee milk tea (75% sweet). However, their boba pearls are a little too squishy and gooey for me.
author: Grace M.

description: I wanted to give 5 stars as the first time I tried this place my taro smoothie boba was pure heavenly perfection consistency flavor-- delicious!!! It was busy and I waited in a long line and it was totally worth it. Sooo I went back as soon as I was in the area again and was hugely disappointed as it was no where close to the same, it was not busy at all this time, the drink was literally watery and it seemed the flavor and the boba were not as good. Consistency is a big deal so only 4 stars as it is an average of 5 and 3 stars. I do appreciate that they use quality & organic ingredients as I don't like fake creamers. I will probably try another location...as I am hooked on that first try! ok went back yet again--giving 5 stars as they carry third culture bakery items, and the mochi muffin was amazing, got plenty of boba, and the crew was nice.
author: marya k.

description: All the Boba Guys locations are consistent on quality, and this location is no exception!  One of my favorites is the humble Lychee Green Milk Tea; can taste the Lychee and the high quality of the milk and boba.  I also recommend any of the fresca teas.  Overall ambiance of this location is great as well, looks great on a sunny day.  I have always liked their pride in transparency and quality ingredients..Boba Guys is by far my favorite in the Bay.
author: Jarrod Y.

description:
HIGHLY RECOMMEND. 

Service & drinks at this locations never fails! Still dying to try out a drink from the nitro menu but i tend to always come in when theyre out :(

til next time, boba guys!
author: Amanda S.

description: If boba is literally in the name of your cafe, you shouldn't call boba a 'topping' and you shouldn't have to pay extra for it.  Wasn't clear that I had to do both these things to get boba here.
author: Jenna C.

description: I don't know another place to get boba in SOMA so this is a nice addition. Sure, it's pricier than other chains, but the quality is on par and the service is really good. Can get pretty crowded at lunch so be prepared.
author: Gonzalo S.

description:
Greatest boba guys spot! Opens as early as 9am on weekdays, what's not to love?!

My guy is addicted to the matcha latte, 75% sweet with oak milk. The oak milk really brings out the nuttiness.

I enjoyed muscat oolong on a hot day. Get it without milk, iced, and no topping (grass jelly would go well with it, but boba seems to be too sweet), 75% sweet.
author: YY M.

description:
Out of all the Boba Guys I've been to, I never have to stress about finding parking at this location. There's plenty of parking in the residential areas across the street.

I always get the strawberry matcha latte which they are really known for. Personally, the other milk teas are a little too milky for my taste. But everyone has their own preferences :) There's some seating, but are usually occupied when I go.
author: Clare H.

description:
Got to finally try the nitro tea. 
They described it like was a Guinness beer. 

Tried the strawberry and gemaicha. It was really interesting and I definitely liked it. But now since I've tried it I more than likely will get my regular milk tea with boba.

They dont add boba to the nitro teas
author: Anne-Mary P.

description:
4 stars because the boba itself is cooked and sweetened to perfection! Of all of the honey boba I've had over the past 20 years, boba guys definitely is in my top 5! Their service is also quick and efficient which is great. 

Minus 1 star though because although the drinks are decent, theyre bland and lack flavor. Tried the milk tea, horchata, and matcha latte. All three were eh.

I'll definitely be back though to try the strawberry matcha latte!
author: Allison H.

description: This is my second time trying Boba Guys. This visit I got the 16oz original milk tea with tapioca and 50% sugar. I waited in line for maybe 5 minutes. The staff was friendly and got my drink made quickly. Also this location has the boba sign on the ground in a bold font. Great for an IG photo
author: Susan M.

description: Love love love. I didn't know what the craze was about until I actually came in and bought the matcha latte. You can choose the level of sweetness along with the type of milk. Must try. I also chose aloe over tapioca.
author: Summer M.

description:
I'm new to this concept, and when I found this location in my nabe I thought I'd try it. I had the black sesame with boba. I loved it. I've had it twice now, but the second time I had it it wasn't stirred, and my first sip was beyond sugary stuff at the bottom of my cup. I guess you need to stir it first.

My complaint is that the line moves sooooooo slow. I have low tolerance for long but slow lines. They need more workers filling orders more quickly.
Also, the layout of the store is awful. One door into the space which also includes a line/bottleneck. Once inside it is difficult to find a waiting space for your order. I'm surprised the fire marshal approved this space.
author: Eebee H.

description:
Been itching to try this because of a video in Facebook and I must say, the Strawberry Match Latte was worth the drive!

My husband had the Natural Taro Smoothie with Almond Jelly and he liked it. He didn't like the Starwberry Match latte though 'cause he's not a fan of matcha drinks, but for matcha lovers like me - this drink is the best!
author: Carmela O.

description: Ordered matcha strawberry and there was not much matcha flavor.  Can tell from the photo that it's not green like the ones at the other locations :(
author: Grace T.

description:
i love this boba place.  I try the Hong Kong style milk tea and I love it. I add the boba and my drink is so good
I like the environment and the sitting.
author: Isabelle L.

description: Surprisingly lives up to the hype! I have tried, and like, the jasmine milk tea and the classic milk tea, with boba and egg pudding. I really like that you're able to customize the milk and the sweetness levels, since I'm lactose-intolerant and usually don't like my drinks too sweet. This specific location seems to have a shorter line in general than others (like, the Mission), and this one is very bright with lots of natural light (read: perfect for IG pics!).
author: Kathy L.

description: Amazing. Best boba I've ever had. I got the original milk tea with boba and my boyfriend got the dirty chai with almond milk. So many options on the menu and very quick regardless of the long line. Love this place and wish I lived closer so I could have this all the time!!
author: Kelsey W.

description:
Despite a line out the door, I've made it in and out in 13 min. 

But they don't take Apple Pay. In a brand new building full of tech folk. I don't remember the last time I couldn't complete a counter transaction due to lack of Apple Pay.
author: Jenn W.

description:
Got two iced matcha lattes and they were both on point, on the same standard of boba guys in the mission and Chinatown, both of which are my go to boba in sf.  

I cannot get enough of the green tea matcha latte. This place definitely filled a hole that was missing in terms of Asian/boba in portrero
author: Patrick J.

description: This boba place is my favorite.I personally recommend the strawberry calipico ,which is milky and tastes like strawberry.Boba Guys is delicious and has interesting pastries which you can enjoy with your drinks.
author: Heidi Y.

description: Best boba tea in town. Love this location because my pup can romp around in the dog park with my hubby while I wait in line to get our milk teas. Only disappointment is that I can't get my strawberry matcha latte with half purée anymore. Just too sweet with the full amount of purée in my opinion, but luckily they have lots of other options. Also, hoping they bring back the Tropic Thunder next summer. That was a great icy combination of sweet and bitter on hot days!
author: Sumilu C.

description: one of my favorite boba places! The matcha latte with boba is my go to! staff is super nice and the service is awesome!
author: Tammy L.

description: A decent boba joint that's become a real trend in the area. Came to get a Matchata, which is a blend between horchata & green tea (matcha), a suggestion that a friend of mine had made to me. In regards to how I found it? The bubbles are just as good as they've always been. Good consistency, texture, and not too hard or soft. Now as for the drink & the concept itself? Personally, I found the matcha in this particular drink to be a bit overpowering ... a little too strong for my particular liking. Reason being that having too much of it tends to give you a much more bitter drink that doesn't go well with the normal sweetness that is found in milk tea in general. The horchata part of the drink wasn't actually too bad though ... the part of the drink that I actually liked. Overall, a worthy boba joint worth stopping into to pick up a drink. The basic black milk tea is pretty good & there are other drinks I'd like to try the next time I'm at this chain again. This location can get a little busy though & the servers take a bit longer than those at others to make your drinks (for the very same reason).
author: Jack M.

description:
me: "can I get a matcha fresca without the puree?"

dude at register: "Um that's just matcha with water"

me: "oh but that's what matcha is right?"

dude: "yea....okay" *takes my order*

girl making the drinks: "hey sorry he shouldn't have been able to sell you that we can't do it without the puree"

*shows me the order slip*
I see on the order slip after my order the dude had typed in "No puree he weird af"

me: "oh why not?"

girl: "it's a seasonal thing it's uniform across all stores."

*me wondering if she means some weird inventory control issue meaning all puree *

me: "well can you just give it to me separately?

girl: "no you can talk to my boss if you want but it's seasonal we can't"

me: "nah that's fine, well can you just add milk if you really have to put something in it?

girl: "no...."

1) what I don't understand is I can still drink just the matcha part if i don't stick my straw completely inside.  so there's no actual enforcement of their "vision" of a drink that's actually very ceremonial and pure in other 

2) I'm not sure why mango being seasonal is a reason?  I even offer them to just give me the puree on the side to allow them to maintain inventory (although that's the actual part that's hard and important to running a restaurant?  not concept, not flavor but inventory control).  It's odd to shift that burden to your customer.  I wasn't asking for them to cook me a chicken instead of tea.  I was asking for them to do rare instead of medium rare.  It would actually take even less work than steak customization which requires extra attention.

3) You guys may jump on the "he weird af" part, but oddly enough that part doesn't actually make me that mad.  The guy was just confused because the owners miseducated him regarding what matcha is, I think?

4) I understand if maybe the Boba Guys owners have decided specifically to prevent the Third Place-ification of Boby Guys.  Perhaps they've read Griffiths and Gilly 2012 (http://journals.sagepub.com/doi/pdf/10.1177/1094670511430530).  There are well studied detrimental effects on business.  But I believe they are far away from this and and many benefits of a cafe on the local community stand to be realized still (see Jeffres 2009 http://engagedscholarship.csuohio.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1011&context=clcom_facpub)

I'm past mad now.  I think I've made it past my blind rage at these continued interactions.  I have less the antediluvian anger of Noah and more the lament of a post-Exilic Jeremiah.

To sum it up, all I'm asking for again is just some respect and inclusion of the customer in the process.  I'm not gonna weave some long weird story of how matcha was a deeply religious and ceremonial part of chinese culture (Chanyuan Qinggui).

I just don't want to feel completely excluded from this long important and typically deeply refreshing relationship between a person and their local watering hole.  It's the last hope I have of slowing the effects outlined in "Bowling Alone: The Collapse and Revival of American Community."

Welcoming cafes and the like have been the seed to many of man's most beautiful moments, the organizational and ideation nucleus of many reactionary movements

The Enlightenment (Parisian cafes)
The Boston Tea Party (Boston taverns)
The French Revolution (Café de Foy)
The 1886 Haymarket Rally (Greif's Hall)
LGBTQ movement (Stonewall Inn and various other gay bars)
Arab Spring (https://youtu.be/lstnsT2JPnc)

You don't need to help change the world!  You can offer solstice against a world that is hard to change.  Some platonic examples include:

Cheers from Cheers
Moe's from The Simpsons
Central Perk from Friends
MacLaren's from HIMYM

It's a mental sanctuary and physical / spiritual refreshment meant to, if not the light, be at least the salt in an otherwise wage slave existence.

Again, not every local cafe needs to change human history.  But living up to that the nobility of the profession is something worth striving for.  I'm not saying Boba Guys has the moral obligation to lead a reversal of America's increased segmentation and tendency to "bowl alone."

So I'm not going to fault them for not doing so.  But it'd be nice if you didn't make it so apparent that our relationship of patron and cafe is 100% transactional and insult your customers in the process.

The rejection of my attempt to encourage this relationship towards something less Mammon-istic is, after contemplation, much more saddening than maddening.
author: Randall L.

description: I am surprised to find out today about the new no cash policy. The notice says the policy is implanted to speed up service. But I have to walk away because I only have cash and didn't expect this at all. I wonder speed up service is better than no service at all??! Curious policy. I would rethink about it if I were management.
author: D. Y.

description: My favorite boba shop is now next to my favorite ballpark and breakfast spot. Hands down the best brews and boba. This location will be getting a lot of my business due to their location and available parking.
author: Joshua F.

description: This is the best boba place I have ever been to.The strawberry latte is my favorite from them.I don't mix it so I can taste the strawberry then at the end of the drink I can taste the matcha latte.So it's like a two in one for me.Definitely recommend if you are near one of these boba places.
author: Elle B.

description: I've been to most of the Boba Guys locations across the bay but this one is probably my favorite just in terms of accessibility, which goes a long way in the city! It is by far located with the best parking solution out of their SF shops, as there's tons of street parking in the adjacent and surrounding areas. Drink quality on par. Their strawberry tea fresca is my favorite! While I wish the store itself had more seating indoors, there is a nice outdoor area right by it for when the weather is right.
author: Glennda H.

description: 50% sweet Hojicha Roasted Milk tea with boba is my favourite and its only available at this location!
author: D C.

description: Great place. No so super friendly but the drinks came out great. A little different than your typical Quicklys. Taste better in my opinion and a bit more fresh. No complaints aside from not so friendly staff members. Great location. Street parking available.
author: Meishi M.

description: Almond jelly.... awesome. But the price! Sf prices for sure! But no one I know in sf makes almond jelly in house and I love it.
author: Ed C.

description: This was my first time at this place and came highly recommended by my brother and SIL. First day I tried the Strawberry matcha with bubbles. Second day I tried the Hong Kong bubble tea with almond jelly and it was so yummy!
author: Susanna L.

description: Five-star for the decorations and the arm bands of the store. Also another five star for their friendly staff and services. Three stars for their drink I don't think that it's super great nor do I think it's super bad it's just a little blend for my teeth and I think the Haight was just too much it didn't live up to the hype.
author: Michele T.

description: Can here during soft opening to check out the new location. Liked that their were more choices than the mission one since I go there the most. Service was a bit slow but understandable since it was their first week, but they messed up on one drink and I let the guy know and he just seemed annoyed and took more than 10 mins to them to switch it out. No apology or even a smile. They need to work on their service skills. Drink itself was fine but mission location is still better.
author: Connie C.

description: Definitely my go-to boba spot. My favorite drinks are the taro smoothie and matcha green tea! Don't be intimidated by the line - the service is super speedy and worth the short wait.
author: Doc R.

description: While I admire their effort to provide the best ingredients, their execution was not great. The tea was very dilute and it tasted like water (even though I got light ice). Boba was on the softer side and not that chewy, although it was sweet. Sure it's boba but not as great as they claim to be if they're using the best ingredients.
author: Doris H.

description: Love the design of the space and all the boba options. Especially love the matcha and horchata bubble teas, and it's great to be able to choose the level of sweetness.
author: N L.

description: We get here before closing. Then the worker with the dubs shirt says she wants to go home so closes the door on us when ppl are inside drinking and getting their orders. Don't go to this location. She told us to go to another location. Lame.
author: Christine K.

description:
not as good as their Hayes valley or Mission location.  The matcha milk tea had very minimal matcha flavor!

Note: if you feature the brand "Strauss organic milk" so prominently in your displays and ads, and also your website http://www.bobaguys.com/faq/ as a reason for your high prices, you should probably use Strauss organic milk =X.  On a recent visit, none of the many gallons of milk behind the counter were Strauss!
author: T Y.

description: Finally a boba place near mission bay! Tried their coffee milk tea with oat milk swapped for the creamer--not bad at all :) It's a little oatmeal-y in flavor but if you don't mind it, I'd recommend giving it a try!
author: Victoria C.

description: Great new boba spot. With all different types of flavors of teas, coffees & blended drinks as well.
author: Jackie F.

description: First time I've seem black sesame (my favorite dessert ever) on a boba menu. So good! Tastes just like those Chinese desserts. The wait for this location is also shorter than most other boba guys
author: Betty H.

description:
even though they open at 9 they don't have bubble tea available until 11:30

and thinking of getting a gift card for a boba lovin pal? well think again they don't offer any denomination less than $20 despite the fact a drink averages $5. The guy claimed the plastic cards are too costly - gimmie a break - then offer paper punch cards! 

place is a total rip off only appealing to the yuppie scum ruining san francisco
author: Marisa L.

description: Solid boba shop, got the oolong milk tea and it was just the right amount creamy, and you can still taste the tea.. you can really tell the ingredients are high quality
author: Kevin C.

description: The best Boba! The milk substitute is great. Recommend the jasmine milk tea. But a little expensive
author: Zoe F.

description: I've been waiting years for a milk tea place to open up in Mission Bay. Not everyone wants coffee! Whenever I try new bubble tea shops, I always go for the plain black milk tea with boba and less sugar, and this did not disappoint. I will have to try out their other drinks/flavors, but so far, I'm a fan!
author: Zell C.

description: I finally got around to trying Boba Guys, and I can officially say I am converted and addicted. I first tried their iced Matcha Latte, and boy, did it live up to its hype. I tried it with their Oat-Milk, which honestly is amazingly good by itself, and will only add the Oat-milk now. The Matcha Latte was sweet and creamy. My next drink was the Strawberry Matcha Latte, and was it really good. It almost tasted like a Mexican Strawberry Agua Frescas drink with Milk & Boba.  My goal is to try everything on the menu. I hope Boba Guys eventually expand to Berkeley. Their Boba Balls are very chewy, maybe a little too chewy for my liking. IMO, if comparing it to Purple Kow Boba Balls, I still think Purple Kow balls are much easier to chew on. Keep it up guys
author: Michelle F.

description: Just tried to do a large order for my office via Postmates and Boba Guys Potrero  apparently refused to fulfill it because they've already done 2 large orders for the day?!?!?! That doesn't make any sense and it's frustrating that they don't have phone lines to be able to communicate with them! I've never heard of a place refusing to do a large order! Is this sheer laziness on their part? This is absolute BS!
author: Mary J.

description: I've been here twice now and I love their HK milk tea, which has condensed milk. Their boba is soft, chewy, and slightly sweet. The staff was very friendly and very accommodating when I couldn't make up my mind. I came here midday so there was no line and there was parking across the street. I'm addicted!
author: Freckles H.

description: Airy and clean boba shop in the new 1010 Potrero building. One of the owners was working behind the counter today--always nice to see! I'd recommend the original flavor or the matcha with tapioca balls. There can be a long queue at random times during the day. Staff are nice and the quality of the product is superior to any other boba place in the city.
author: K J.

description: I've had Boba all over the bay area and these guys are definitively doing it well. All the flavors taste fresh and natural, and the texture of their boba is consistently good. They do have some nice treats as well. Kinda wish they had more snacks, but I'm reviewing them for their tea. They do have a charcoal pineapple cake that is by far one of my favorite treats.
author: Esteban A.

description: AmaZing boba! Green tea matcha latte is amazing. Also their cotton candy is unique and exciting
author: Amber R.

description: Same great service like other boba guys, drinks came sweeter than other locations but they were super cool about remaking them. Nice chill location and they actually have tables to sit at and a wonderful park next door.
author: Anthony C.

description: This is to counter-balance Randall L's rude review. Because no one likes a stinker. :)
author: Anthony R.

description: I only go to Boba Guys because they do decaf black tea. However, their tea is often wayyy overbrewed-to the point of being bitter and unpleasant to drink. I haven't had this problem at their Hayes Valley location, but tea quality at this location is very inconsistent. I don't like their boba, so I order without. I do love that they do oat milk instead of soy now- it's really good!
author: Diana C.

description: Great variety of flavored teas though not a fan of the texture of the tapioca pearls; a bit hard and may be steeped in syrup for too long. Would love to try a few more flavors, still a great spot for a bubble tea craving and a yummy snack to pair with.
author: Chatel T.

description: My preferred location because there's usually no lines. Plenty of parking on the weekends and a little harder to find parking on the weekdays. I always get the 25% sweetness and I always taste the flavor of the teas.  Love Boba Guys!
author: D V.

description: Love this place !!!!! my go to place for milk tea , usually always get the jasmine milk tea with their homemade almond jelly or grass jelly. IT HITS THE SPOT!
author: Ben Z.

description: No matter how picky I am when it comes to boba, Esmeralda always gets it right. Try their strawberry rice milk and strawberry calipico! wish we could adjust the sweetness for strawberry drinks tho! Go Esmeralda
author: Eing O.

description: My favorite little Boba spot with wonderful staff. Their suggestions are never bad and happy to help newbies to the Boba. If you have four bucks in your pocket and looking for a nice refreshing drink, hit up Boba Guys.
author: Chelsey W.

description: Great customer service!! Hint: if you ask for no milk, there's a 10% off discount, and if you work nearby, show them your badge and you might be able to get another discount!!!
author: Elizabeth L.

description: I went in to Boba Guys on Sunday. I was greeted by Mirley. I was not sure what to order so i asked her what she recommended and she offered the new caramel matcha. She also recommended hojicha with oat milk. I was hesitant but i got both and she said if I didn't like it I could exchange it for something else!  The oat milk blended very well together with my drink which the drink 10 times bShe gave a friendly smile and was very accommodating.
author: Delaina J.
